title: NA better than EU confirmed
body:
TSM won IEM and SK didn't do anything while they were there.

Thoughts on this?

replies.body: I am from Europe, and have to say that TSM did play really well, and SK really dropped the ball. I feel that TSM would have lost to GE Tigers, and that GE really choked in that they expected that they could steam-roll over WE, and got rather frustrated when their plans didn't work out as well as they should have. Still, TSM would have beat SK if they were the 2 teams playing in the finals, so congrats to TSM for their win.

> [{quoted}](name=stuartk11,realm=EUW,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=qVALJxAH,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-03-15T21:41:31.479+0000)
>
> I am from Europe, and have to say that TSM did play really well, and SK really dropped the ball. I feel that TSM would have lost to GE Tigers, and that GE really choked in that they expected that they could steam-roll over WE, and got rather frustrated when their plans didn't work out as well as they should have. Still, TSM would have beat SK if they were the 2 teams playing in the finals, so congrats to TSM for their win.

I don't really know if it is choking so much as GE meeting their foil. WE thrived on early game leads, and is really damn good at snowballing. GE tends to give up a lot of early game leads. They just faced a team that was too good at snowballing. TSM on the other hand is really good at stopping snowballing with cross map counter-play. WE is weak at playing from even since their entire team comp is focused on snowballing. Basically WE is a brawler team that walked right into a TSM counter punch. GE is an infighter that takes some hits to get that winning K.O. combo. WE just hits too damn hard and GE can't get their balance.
Give this man a spot on the analyst desk. I love TSM and would like to think that they're the best but I wouldn't be super confident in them rolling over GE Tigers.

If woulds and coulds were candy and nuts, wouldn't it be a Merry Christmas?

Other than that TSM RULEZ!

> [{quoted}](name=stuartk11,realm=EUW,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=qVALJxAH,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-03-15T21:41:31.479+0000)
>
> I am from Europe, and have to say that TSM did play really well, and SK really dropped the ball. I feel that TSM would have lost to GE Tigers, and that GE really choked in that they expected that they could steam-roll over WE, and got rather frustrated when their plans didn't work out as well as they should have. Still, TSM would have beat SK if they were the 2 teams playing in the finals, so congrats to TSM for their win.

We might just have to find out at all-stars as it is likely not necessarily that both teams will make it their.
Do you even know what all-stars is? Lol. People vote to make teams of random favorite players. Teams dont go as a whole the next time we will see is at the invitational in May.
All-Stars got changed last year. It's just the top team and then the favorites are sent for other categories. Personally I didn't really like it but the reasoning was sound.

Im pretty sure you are wrong.

http://na.lolesports.com/articles/official-all-star-challenge-teams-locked

Pretty sure you were wrong...at least partially:

http://lol.gamepedia.com/All-Star_Paris_2014

> **The All-Star Invitational**
Top five teams from each regional pro league.
Round robin group stage, Best of One matches.
Top four teams are placed into a playoff bracket.
Semifinals are Best of Three; Finals are Best of Five.

The link you provided was the AllStar Challenge (exhibition matches). That consisted of Hexakill, URF, Pick 10 and the 1v1/2v2 matches. 

Where players for these were popularity contests for just these show matches. Not the Actual Invitational.
Feel awkward now?

U guys obiously havent watched China LCS, OMG, ROYAL, and Edward Gaming are looking very strong, and TSM winning IEM was because GET fuked up. They thought they coudl steam roll WE the LAST PLACE TEAM IN CHINA. If you followed the entire world LCS not just a few, EU is the weakest right now, CHINA is top, and korean is coming second. TSM/NA is really just between the entire spectrum. They are just mediocre compare to the rest of the world. I hate to say this, i love Dyrus, but if this keeps up, they are at risk of doing poorly at worlds. Dyrus needs to do better than he is now. I am not saying hes doing bad, but he needs to step up his game and be more aggressive with his team. Hes pretty much campped every match and tower farm and ganked every other couple of mins. This will work for CLG as an easy bait and have them constantly focus dyrus, but NOT china and korean teams. They rotate so fast and smooth, theres no way to grab objectives or do something. It is so crazy right now.
No Fnatic in the competition==no contest.  Without the *real* best team in EU you cannot make comparison of USA vs EU...

Don't forget, Fnatic isn't a 100% EU team, they had to get Koreans. TROLOLOL

Source of this (100% EU) Blame Fasmodey (EUW) and other EU fanboys :
> Because Bjergsen is %100 EU.

> [{quoted}](name=Vixanys,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=qVALJxAH,comment-id=000b0000,timestamp=2015-03-17T20:44:08.975+0000)
>
> Don't forget, Fnatic isn't a 100% EU team, they had to get Koreans. TROLOLOL
> 

Just because they have "Koreans" doesn't mean the team is Korean.  Anerica has people from everywhere but yet we don't start to classify them as "mixed country teams".  The leadership/style of the respectful teams remain the local regions... regardless of who is playing.  Same goes for TSM's Mid laner:  Once EU... now NA style gameplay...

That's a refreshing outlook. If you look at the most of the comments on this thread, you will see how people complain about a team having Bjerg, because he once played in EU.

My comment on your's was just a troll on a common theme in this entire thread. Bjerg came from EU, so TSM must be an EU team in NA. Trolololol

Fnatic are kind of in the same boat as SK, they can really play one style. Ban Rengar, Rumble, and Lissandra, and this limits them ALOT. Huni can't play a tank for the life of him. While Fnatic is doing very well, I don't think they would've done better than SK
Because Bjergsen is %100 EU.

3 Koreans and 1 NA Pro (as a coach) in the top 3 teams of EU LCS.
#2 teams in EU win only 1 game in IEM Katowice.

Your comment, while salty, is not relevant and you should be ashamed.

Koreans are awesome dude they're carrying so good omg. 

Bjergsen is way better than them. Without Bjergsen TSM is freaking useless.

bjerson is a beast, cant argue there...but that useless bit i really dont see. Its as if you watch bjergson stream and have never seen tsm play. Dyrus is pretty amazing, and Santorin is probably the best jungler TSM has ever seen. If you havent seen Turtle get quadra kills in a losing game back back...you really should check the vods, and saying lustboy is useless shows youre really not paying attention.

> [{quoted}](name=ToiletteOfDoom ,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=qVALJxAH,comment-id=0005000000000001,timestamp=2015-03-16T17:31:19.224+0000)

If you havent seen Turtle get quadra kills in a losing game back back...you really should check the vods, and saying lustboy is useless shows youre really not paying attention.

I think Santorin is really grossly underrated. He is fantastic on RekSai and had a great Nid game last weekend.

Lustboy is fantastic on Janna. I have been underwhelmed with his play on other champs though.
Kappa
Bjerg is USA citizen now. 100% NA confirmed
Im not sure if NA is better than EU...BUT TSM is at least at the moment. If they continue to improve...i can see them winning worlds.

You can see them winning worlds...

... in your dreams.

Still not gonna happen.
Damn...someones salty, im not gonna point any fingers at who but....you mad or nah?

nah

I just think, that it is highly unlikely.

well i dont see any other region besides korea winning it. And TSM is the only one i can tell that shows any promise of contending that #1 in the world seat. Although I really like Fnatic right now, they have huge potential.
well ye. If any NA/EU team gets into World finals it will probably be TSM.
welcome to dark side my friend ;) i will happily buy you a TSM summoner icon if you promise to rock it the rest of the season :P

nah, i am going with my man Freeze.
Copenhagen ftw.
Cant say you arent loyal :)

Yea I honestly don't see EU going anywhere this season. NA did it right, they invested like mad, into teams, into players, into coaches. While EU area still being proud of their S1 win. Let's see how many seasons it takes to realise that it won't work like that anymore. They better get their stuff together and start investing too, if they want to stay relevant in an international competition.
100% Agree with you, but you just stirred up a flaming war...

guys, China top teams this year will steam roll lots of other teams in coming matches. They are looking stronger than ever, watch China LCS you guys will understand. I am a TSM fanboy but honestly, they played really well, but GET lost due to like the first dude stated, cockiness. They thought they could win without trying, ended up underestimating WE, tilted, and lost. That said, TSM played really well if they continue to grow and play even better just like they did this IEM and stay CONSISTENT, they will definitely make it into semi-finals. But still China teams are looking really good better than Koreans right now.

...then you realize that TSM split 1-1 against SHRC in S4 Championships, the same SHRC that has finished runner-up in the last 2 World Championships. And that was with an inferior jungler, Bjergsen still getting used to shot-calling, and only having Lustboy on the roster for about a month. China may be stronger now, but so is TSM.
n/c
Yeah seriously if TSM beat WE so hard, GE Tigers stood no chance.
Except for the fact that they have a known pedo on their team, that's awesome.

* **Article 5**: Failure to praise the TSM overlords (Docked 3 Points)
